etymologies: early 17th century: from French marmotte, probably via Romansh murmont from late Latin mus montanus ‘mountain mouse’

definitions: a heavily built, gregarious, burrowing rodent of both Eurasia and North America, typically living in mountainous country.

notes.text: Genus Marmota, family Sciuridae: several species

shortDefinitions: heavily built, gregarious burrowing rodent of mountainous country
